shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction (fols. 2ra-5v) - Mäqdǝmä wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 2ra-5rb l.18) - “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 5rb l.19-5va l.30) - On the reliability of the Gospels (fols. 5va l.31-5vb l.13) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 5vb-47rb) - Biography of Matthew (fol. 5vb l.13-l.30) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 5vb l.30-l.34) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fol. 5vb-6va) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 8ra-47ra) - Postscript (fol. 47rb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 47rb-73rb) - Biography of Mark (fol. 47rb-47va l. 4) - Statement about the Eusebian sections (fol. 47va l.4-l.8). - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 41va-47vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 48ra-) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 74ra-117ra) - Biography of Luke (fols. 73rb-73va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 83 titles (fol. 73vab) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 74ra-117ra) V) Gospel of John (fols. 118va-139vb) - Biography of John (fol. 118va-151rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 20 titles (fol. 118vab) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 119ra-151rb)
Additiones 1-6.

copyists.copyist: The scribe who wrote Additiones 2 and 6 is Mänbärä Krǝstos.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was resewn. A small rectangular piece of parchment is sewn on fols. 1v, 2r, 3r and 4r with parchment threads to repair holes.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on both leather covers: three frames with a cross inside (at least 6 tools are used: single line fillet, cross hatching, double circle, x-form, interlaced line fillet, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of stitches at the spine cover. All quires are reinforced with parchment guards of different size.

txfolios.txfolio: (151-1) Foliation mistake: The fol. after 120 was foliated as 122 (number 121 is missing).

squires.squire:
I(7/fols. 1r-7v) – II(8/fols. 8r-15v) – III(8/fols. 16r-23v) – IV(8/fols. 24r-31v) – V(8/fols. 32r-39v) – VI(8/fols. 40r-47v) – VII(8/fols. 48r-55v) – VIII(8/fols. 56r-63v) – IX(8/fols. 64r-73v) – X (8/fols. 74r - 81v) – XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – XIV (8/fols. 106r-113v) – XV(5; s.l. 4, stub after 2 (?)/fols. 114r-118v) – XVI(8/fols. 119r-127v) – XVII (8/fols. 128r-135v) – XVIII(8/fols. 136r-143v) – XIX(8/fols. 144r-151v)
The structure of quire I cannot be identified. It seems that fols. 2-3 as well as fols. 4-6 are sewn together with parchment threads; fols. 1 and 8 may form one bifiolio.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Very careful and regular. Written by trained hand.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
The handwriting remains very uniform throughout the Ms. with slender, tall and upright letters; tze script shows typical palaeographic features of the mid-16th until mid-17th cent. as well as a few archaic features.
Characteristics: - uniform shapes of the letters - slender proportions and parallel downstrokes - broadly spaced letters - form of 'six' (፮, looking like "compressed" number 'seven') - numeral 'ten' (፲) has a peculiar rare form with a ring on fol. 5vb (cp. Synaxarion of QDQ-004). - ው with marker of the 6th order closer to the top than in the middle - መ and ሠ of smaller size than other characters, but written in the upper limit of the line - the loops of መ are mostly separate in all vowel orders - ጥ written with short curves - tendency to keep open vocalization loops of the 5th order.
See: UhlPal 425-544.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; groups of lines on the incipit page of the introduction and of each Gospel; incipits of all sections (one or two initial lines); section numbers; the word mǝˤǝraf "chapter"; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The "Golden Gospel" book of Qändaʿro Qǝddus Qirqos church. - The canon tables are missing. - The space left for the rubricated, initial lines of 'On the reliability of the Gospels' is unfilled (fol. 5va). - No opening lines for the Gospel of Mark, the Gospel of Luke and the Gospel of John. - The “tituli” of the Gospel of Matthew are only partly numbered (until “tituli” 15); the “tituli” of the Gospel of Mark and of the Gospel of Luke are not numbered; the numbers of the “tituli” of the Gospel of John are mistaken, after "10" follows 20 up to 29.

additional.cont: Fol. 6v: Record concerning a reconciliation agreement.
additional.det: Written in Amharic. The reconciliation took place on 23 Mäskäräm 1889 A.M. (= 3 October 3 1934 A.D.); the document is sealed with fingerprints.

additional.cont: Fol. 43v: Excerpt from Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥəmamat "Book of the Rite of the Holy Week" (reading for Monday).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin in the same hand as Additio 6.

additional.cont: Fol. 47vb: Reconciliation note.
Fol. 117ra-va: Excerpt from the Ṣoma dǝggwa, Antiphonary for Lent (zä-ˁarb zä-sǝqlät).
additional.det: Written in the same hand in small script as the short excerpts at the end of each gospel (see: Other Details), with musical notation.

additional.cont: Fol. 117va-118ra: Record concerning the rules for the association (maḫbär) of Qändaˁro Qəddus Qirqos (e.g., administration of land, periods of service of priests and deacons, wages).
additional.det: Written in Amharic in a crude hand. Two short notes were added at the end amending the rules, in pen.

additional.cont: Fol. 148ra: Signature of the scribe, exhortation.
additional.tran: Fol. 148ra: Do not forget me, the scribe Mänbärä Krǝstos, in your prayer (recite for me) the Pater Noster one (time).
additional.det: Written in the upper margin in the same hand as Additio 2.

extras.extra: - The introduction and the special introductions to each Gospel (biographies and lists of “tituli”) are written in small script. - Short excerpts from the Ṣoma dǝggwa (Antiphonary for Lent) with musical notation for Good Friday at the end of each Gospel are written (in the same hand as Additio 5) in the upper margin of fols. 44ra-46ra, 71ra-71vb, 113ra-115ra and 146vb-148ra; these fols. contain also remarks in the side margins/intercolumn indicating an assigned reading at a certain time of a day; additional notes on these fols. were erased. - Several short remarks are written interlineally or in the margins, in pen or ink, e.g., concerning St. Qirqos: fols. 21va, 30rb, 31vb; the feast of Däbrä Tabor: fols. 29rb, 60ra. the feast of Däbrä Zäyt: fol. 38va. - A few corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 2vb, 3ra, 71rb. - A few erasures: fols. 2rb, 2vb, 3va, 4va, 8r, 61va, 151rb [4 lines]. - Pen trial: fol. 40v - A few words crudely written in pen: e.g., fols. 11r, 20r, 31v, 33v, 110r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - In the Gospel of John the days of the week are written in the upper margin in the same hand as Additio 3: ዘሰኑይ: fol. 119r ዘሰሉስ: fol. 128r ዘራብዑ: fol. 133v ዘሐሙስ: fol. 138v ዘዐርብ: fol. 142v ዘቀዳሚት: fol. 144v ዘእኁድ: fol. 149r. - Orange threads are vinserted in the upper corner of fols. 10, 48, 78, 119.

miniature.info: Fol. 7ra: The nine feasts of Our Lord Jesus Christ represented as seven saints.
miniature.details:
Caption: በዓለ፡ ፱ቱ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። 'The nine feasts of our Lord Jesus Christ'.
The names of the feasts are written above the heads of the saints: ትስብእት 'The Incarnation' (29 Mäggabit), ልደት 'The Nativity' (29 Taḫśaś), ግዝረት 'The Circumcision of the Lord' (6 Ṭǝrr), ጥምቀት 'The Baptism' (11 Ṭǝrr), ልደተ፡ ስምዖን 'Presentation of the Lord' (8 Yäkkatit), ትንሣዔ 'The Resurrection' (mobile), እርገት 'The Ascension' (mobile), ጰራቅሊጦስ 'Pentecost' (mobile), ደብረ፡ ታቦር 'The Transfiguration, i.e. Mount-Tabor' (13 Näḥase).
See for the feasts: FRITSCH, EMMANUEL: The Liturgical Year of the Ethiopian Church, Addis Abäba 2001 (Ethiopian Review of Cultures. Special Issue. Vol. IX-X), pp. 60-61.
